data.chText: 普遍的；全体的；全世界的；共同的
data.enText: done by or involving all the people in the world or in a particular group

data.chText: 这类问题是老年人的通病。
data.enText: Such problems are a universal feature of old age.

data.chText: 这个问题几乎取得全体一致的意见。
data.enText: Agreement on this issue is almost universal.
universal suffrage (= the right of all the people in a country to vote)

data.chText: 普遍存在的；广泛适用的
data.enText: true or right at all times and in all places

ex.chText: 一种普遍的错误观念认为：东西越贵，质量就会越好。
ex.enText: It is a popular misunderstanding that the higher the price is, the better the product will be.

ex.chText: 对于实名购买火车票制度，民众意见有分歧吗？
ex.enText: Was popular opinion divided on the real-name train ticket system?

synonyms.bx: 指想法、信仰等为大部分人所持有并接受的，只作定语。

ex.chText: 成年人失眠是常有的事。
ex.enText: Insomnia is fairly common among adults.

ex.chText: 小孩子不敢一个人睡觉是很常见的。
ex.enText: It is common for children to be afraid of sleeping alone.

synonyms.bx: 指经常在多人身上或多个地方发生的。

ex.chText: 这部电影是关于普通人的。
ex.enText: This movie is about ordinary people.

ex.chText: 体育锻炼理应是日常生活的一部分。
ex.enText: Physical exercise should be part of ordinary life.

ex.chText: 我推荐这本小说是因为它是用平凡的语言写成的。
ex.enText: I recommend this novel because it is written in ordinary language.

synonyms.bx: 指平常的，没有不同或特别之处的。

ex.chText: 房价是人们普遍关注的一个问题。
ex.enText: House price is a topic of universal interest.

synonyms.bx: 指包括某一群体中的每个人在内的，无一例外。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：普通的，普遍的

tr: coupling that connects two rotating shafts allowing freedom of movement in all directions
example: in motor vehicles a universal joint allows the driveshaft to move up and down as the vehicle passes over bumps

tr: a behavioral convention or pattern characteristic of all members of a particular culture or of all human beings
example: some form of religion seems to be a human universal

tr: (logic) a proposition that asserts something of all members of a class
(linguistics) a grammatical rule (or other linguistic feature) that is found in all languages

example: the shrewdest political and ecumenical comment of our time"- Christopher Morle

tr: adapted to various purposes, sizes, forms, operations
applicable to or common to all members of a group or set
example: the play opened to universal acclaim
rap enjoys universal appeal among teenage boys

value.def: Something that is universal relates to everyone in the world or everyone in a particular group or society.

example.ex: The insurance industry has produced its own proposals for universal health care...
example.tran: 保险业提出了自己的全民医疗保健方案。

example.ex: The desire to look attractive is universal.
I have been amazed at the universality of all of our experiences, whatever our origins, sex or age.
example.tran: 尽管我们的身世、性别和年龄各不相同，但令我惊讶的是我们都有着共同的经历。

value.def: Something that is universal affects or relates to every part of the world or the universe.
A universal is a principle that applies in all cases or a characteristic that is present in all members of a particular class.

example.tran: 没有普遍适用的经济学原理。

trans: (同时经营银行业务和股票经纪业务的)全能银行，综合银行
普遍语法(据信能够描述所有语言的一系列规则)
通用指示剂(通过颜色变化显示物质的酸碱性)
